adjectives.description: forethoughtful (comparative more forethoughtful, superlative most forethoughtful)

entries.meaning: Having or full of forethought; provident; proactive; visionary.
examples: But we live in an age of the world when a spirit is abroad which is more than directly and blessedly influential on the present,— which is forethoughtful and prospective, casting its relations like strong grappling-irons over the future, and claiming its issues.
